Package com.github.yellowstonegames.core

Class DistributedRandom

java.lang.Object
com.github.yellowstonegames.core.DistributedRandom
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
public class DistributedRandom extends Object implements com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
An EnhancedRandom that delegates to a FourWheelRandom, but runs it through a user-controlled IDistribution.SimpleDistribution to distribute any floats, ints, or doubles as by that distribution. Generating random long values is trickier because a distribution works on doubles, and doubles only provide 52 bits of usable random data, while a long can need as many as 64.

    • nextGaussian

      public double nextGaussian()
      Because nextGaussian() already specifies a distribution, this uses EnhancedRandom.nextGaussian() as-is.
      Specified by:
      nextGaussian in interface com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
      Returns:
      the next pseudorandom, approximately Gaussian ("normally") distributed double value with mean 0.0 and standard deviation 1.0 from this random number generator's sequence

    • nextExclusiveDouble

      public double nextExclusiveDouble()
      This acts the same as EnhancedRandom.nextExclusiveDoubleEquidistant(); it does not use the optimizations from EnhancedRandom.nextExclusiveDouble(), because those aren't reasonable when distributed.
      Specified by:
      nextExclusiveDouble in interface com.github.tommyettinger.ds.support.EnhancedRandom
      Returns:
      a pseudo-random double between 0.0, exclusive, and 1.0, exclusive
